elements.name: Auftrag
elements.title: Has a contract been concluded in the following examples or not? Give reasons for your answer in each case.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Emily Hug receives a loan commitment from her bank for the loan she has applied for. Emily signs the loan documents and returns them to the bank.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: Emily Hug had applied for a loan. The bank sent her a binding application. Emily accepted it. A contract has therefore been concluded.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Mrs. Tobler calls a hotel and asks for a room for one night. The hotelier tells her she can have a room for CHF 150. Mrs. Tobler agrees.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: The contract was concluded verbally. The hotelier offered her a room for one night for CHF 150. Ms. Tobler accepted the offer.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Has a contract been concluded in the following examples or not? Give reasons for your answer in each case.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: You go to the supermarket and pick up a few things. At the checkout, you place the items on the conveyor belt and pay. You don't say a word to the angry sales clerk.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: The contract has been concluded tacitly (Art. 1 para. 2 CO).

elements.name: question7
elements.title: An aid organization sends you a stack of art cards with an invoice.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Reason
elements.correctAnswer: The sending of an unordered item does not legally constitute a request (Art. 6a OR). Therefore, no contract has been concluded. You do not have to pay for or return the cards.
